intro: Rhabdadenia cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban rock cactus, is a succulent plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its short, cylindrical stems covered in spines. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, appearing at the base of the stems. Rhabdadenia cubensis is a slow-growing species that thrives in full sun and requires minimal water.
